alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 17 at 11:52AM MST until August 17 at 3:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Pipeline Fire Scar in... Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 300 PM MST. * At 1152 AM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Pipeline Fire Scar. Up to 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Pipeline Fire Scar. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Pipeline Fire Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Wupatki Trails and Timberline. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 425 and 430. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Immediately move out of and away from creeks and washes in the Pipeline Fire Scar. Flash flooding is occurring or imminent. Turn Around, Don`t Drown if you encounter flood waters while driving.
